title: Edge on Demand: Offensive Halloween to Offensive Crosses
text:
Story Created: Oct 12, 2015 at 10:38   12, 2015 at 11:37 PM EDT 
A school district in Connecticut has been under fire for its decision to ban Halloween parades and costumes in schools. District officials say they don't want to exclude children who could not participate in the events because of religious reasons. 
But after parents spoke out against the decision, the Superintendent lifted the ban and said all Halloween activities would be reinstated at schools district-wide. 

So we want to know what you think: Should students be allowed to celebrate Halloween in schools? 
Plus: "Offensive" Cross Removed From Playground No Charges for Cecil the Lion's Killer Vin Diesel Shuts Down Body Shamers
